section.title: Detecting Android
section.p: The android global variable is set to true when running on the Android version of NVList.

section.title: Text Rendering
section.p: Text rendering between the desktop and Android versions of NVList are different on a fundamental level. Desktop NVList renders text to the screen one character at a time, while the Android version draws an entire paragraph to a texture and renders that. Also, the Android version renders text at the screen's native resolution for increased sharpness.

In most cases it's better to disable custom textboxes when running on Android. The system resizes/positions the textbox on Android based on user preferences, so any custom textbox would need to handle this dynamic positioning (the built-in customTextBox function doesn't).

section.title: GLSL
section.p: The current version of NVList for Android uses GLES 1.0/1.1, which is roughly equivalent in capabilities to OpenGL 1.3 (which is rather old). Unfortunately GLES 1.x doesn't support hardware shaders (required by some special effects, notably the BitmapTween) even on graphics hardware which does have shaders.

section.title: Save Screen
section.p: Android will default to using its own save/load screens.

ul.li: Image/sound preloading doesn't currently work on Android (preload does nothing).
JNG/KTX image formats are not supported.
Theora video isn't supported on all devices (but you can use other video formats).
Textures will use the system default format (usually RGB565 or RGBA8888).
